title: Financial/Budget Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Amherst College (Amherst, MA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: One of the more degrading interviews I have ever been a part of. After a phone interview and a second round in person interview, I sent a thank you email. It’s been 3 months and I still have not heard anything. Not a note to say they would get back to me, or a simple rejection. The manager seemed overworked and was very condescending, even though I’m pretty sure I had more experience than she does. Seems like a terrible place to work.
Interview Questions: Test of excel proficiency Asked about how I collaborated with others

title: SURF Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Amherst College
Interview Descriptions: There was no live interview, just a written application. Written application is a personal statement which is around one page where you are asked to explain why you are interested in SURF and what background has prepared you for it.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Amherst College
Interview Descriptions: Phone, in person (5 hours), meeting with HR, phone follow-up with questions.  Phone was quick with lots of questions; in person was with about 15 individuals with a round robin of example-based on theory based questions.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Amherst?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed! Amherst college was a very chill interviewer, and you are allowed to be very honest about your identity and experiences with higher education. It is pretty comfortable and casual.
Interview Questions: Tell me your experience with identity.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Amherst College (Amherst, MA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was more conversational between me and the professor. I shared a bit about my interests in the research topic and details about my background in the area of study.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this lab?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Amherst College
Interview Descriptions: I first interviewed with the supervisor. This took about thirty minutes. I was asked about my relevant experience then I was given different scenarios to think through. I then interviewed with two current interns. They asked me about my strengths and weaknessess.
Interview Questions: How would you handle dealing with multiple tasks at once?

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Amherst College (Amherst, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard tech questions. They want to get a feel of the tech information you have and the customer relations skills you have. Reading a website like TechCrunch or Verge will help you wow them with having a grip on what's happening in the world of tech

title: Director, Donor Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Amherst College (Amherst, MA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: It started with a 30 min phone interview, 1 hour face to face one week later. Overall a positive experience where the interviewer should a lot of respect and courtesy. I'm impressed with the processes.

title: Campus Center Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Amherst College
Interview Descriptions: I applied through a friend who was currently a campus center manager and liked the job. The interview was easy, a few fit questions but nothing more. The pay is good and you get to do your homework!
Interview Questions: Dealing with drunk students in the wee hours of the morning.

title: Network Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Amherst College (Amherst, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Initial communications were cordial enough.  The telephone interview was fair.  Being asked to come to the campus for 7 hours was I feel a little excessive though.  By the end of that one gets off one's game and tends to slowly self-sabotage.  People were friendly enough except for HR who I feel was looking for cracks in the dyke, took a mildly suspicious approach.
Interview Questions: Being over 40 earlier I was advised to drop the previous jobs over 10 years old or so.  HR seemed maybe annoyed, as if I were trying to hide something.  They had no bearing on the position anyway.

title: Visiting Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Amherst College
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted as one of a team, invited as visiting faculty to teach a single seminar, at the recommendation of the senior faculty member taking leave at that time. The vetting was thorough, and though not required, called for a personal visit to the campus.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions. This was a civilized procedure, not a gauntlet.

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Amherst College (Amherst, MA)
Interview Descriptions: It was quite simple. I filled out a paper available at the Front Desk and was called 2 days later for an interview the next day. Spoke with the immediate supervisor and the senior manager of the library, for about 10 minutes. Questions were straightforward and revolved around what my academic schedule is like/how reliable I am/if I've ever worked in a library before.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions - "Describe your previous library and archival experience."

title: Library Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: Had to fill out an application form from the library. Immediate supervisor set up a time to meet, then went over my application form with me. Agreed to hire me and started setting up schedule on the spot. Pretty simple.

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Amherst College (Amherst, MA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was highly involved. First there was a phone screening, then there was a full day of appointments where I met every person in the department, took a proofreading test and a data entry test, got a tour of the building, and was interviewed by HR.
Interview Questions: Describe your job history and what you're looking for now.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Amherst College
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a motivational letter as well as a resume, a number of applicants were ignited to an interview with the head of the exchange program and a representative of the college. The interview took place about 4 months after submitting the documents. After an additional three weeks the applicants received a letter informing them about the outcome of their interview.
Interview Questions: What do you think about stereotypes and would you use them in your classes?

title: Commentator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Amherst College (Amherst, MA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I asked director if I could do the JeffCast and he said sure we need more help.
Interview Questions: Do you know much about sports?
